ovdesc.p: This table contains company level default values that must be set up for the Mutual Funds module to run correctly.
These defaults will apply irrespective of the application, transaction type, or user. One record must be created for each company running the Mutual Funds module.

desc.p: The default category code to be used if transaction fees (i.e switch fees ) is not setup and entered manually in the transaction.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Misc fees.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid credit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.
The default category to be used for the contra account which is used for adjusting the control account balance.
The contra entries would be raised from SEC.TRADE, SECURITY.TRANSFER and corporate actions.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code in the range 10000 - 19999.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Discount Amount.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid debit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.
The default product category to be used for Mutual Funds module.
Mandatory Input
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code in the range 22000 - 22999
Specifies the category code to be used for the posting of exchange Profit & Loss entries.

This code classifies profit & loss and product types. Each business transaction of T24 will be allocated a Category code which will enable reports to be constructed that give an accurate view of the bank's position.
5 numeric characters. Mandatory Input.
Must be in range 50-000 to 59-999.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code.
The default category code to be used if transaction fees (i.e entry load ) is not setup and entered manually in the transaction.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.

This field is used to set the value date for a trade. If no date is specified in the VALUE.DATE field in MF.TRADE application, the system will check this field ( provided SETTLEMENT.DAYS in MF.FUND.MASTER is not set ) to arrive at the value date by adding the default days (working days) in this field to the DEAL.DATE field in MF.TRADE application.
3 Numeric characters.
Specifies the COMPANY code for which the parameters are setup.
Mandatory Input. Must be a valid COMPANY Id.

This field is used to set the expiry date for an order. If no date is specified in the ORDER.EXP.DATE field in MF.ORDER application, the system will check this field to arrive at the expiry date by adding the default days (working days) in this field to the value in the ORDER.DATE field in MF.ORDER application. On expiry of an order, the order is moved to history
3 Numeric characters.
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Other fees.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid credit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.
The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Profits.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory Input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
The transaction code used to signify which type of transaction is being posted, for exchange Losses.
To facilitate the recognition of the transaction code numbers with the application to which they refer, ranges have been assigned to each application.
1-10(Max Value) numeric characters Transaction Code.
The Maximum value is specified in EB.OBJECT for TRANSACTION.
Mandatory Input.
Must exist as a valid Transaction Code.
The internal account category to be used if the previous field SETT.ACCT.TYPE is 'INTERNAL'.
Mandatory input if settlement account type is 'INTERNAL'. Input is not allowed otherwise.
Must be a valid internal account CATEGORY code in the range 10000 - 19999.

Specifies whether 'NOSTRO' or 'INTERNAL' account has to be used as the settlement account if payment mode in the transaction is other than 'ACCOUNT'. For ex: if the payment is by cheque/credit card/cash or by transfer from an outside bank account,the settlement account would be either an internal account (cheque/cash cleared) or a Nostro account (specified for the currency in NOSTRO.ACCOUNT table).
Mandatory Input. Allowed values are 'NOSTRO' or 'INTERNAL'
The default category code to be used if transaction fees (i.e exit load ) is not setup and entered manually in the transaction.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
The default transaction type that would be used in corporate actions for fund reinvestment.
Must be a valid SC.TRANS.NAME ID
The OFS.SOURCE record which would be used for creation of MF.TRADE using OFS processing.
The field is multi-valued to allow processing of other applications in future.
Mandatory Input. Must be a valid OFS.SOURCE record id.
Fields OFS.SOURCE and OFS.VERSION form a related multi-value set.
The version to be used for OFS processing. Should be given with along with the application name.
eg:- 'MF.TRADE,OFS'
Mandatory Input. Must be a valid VERSION record id
Fields OFS.SOURCE and OFS.VERSION form a related multi-value set.

This field is to determine whether fund GL is required or not.Additional entries would be raised if it is set. Even though the fees (entry load,exit load,switch fees,trailing fees,safekeeping fees,management fees etc) arise from the fund, all these are either a charge or an income to the FMC that is managing the fund.A fund GL is required to determine the assets/liabilities and income/expenses of the fund. The FMC GL would the bank GL and the book GL is the GL of the fund which is separate from FMC GL.If FUND GL REQD is set to Y, then all the income and expenses pertaining to the fund will be reflected in the fund book also besides the FMC book. It must be noted that all fees entry will be raised in the main company's books as this will be the FMC book, the GL of which is published whereas fund GL is required for fund B/S and PL reporting.If this is not set, no additional entries would be raised.
Validation Rules:.
Optional Input. Values allowed are ''Y' or '' ( null )

This would be a parallel of the agent account in the main company's books. This will be an internal account.The internal account category has to be specified here. Mandatory field if FUND GL REQD is set to 'Y'.
Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code in the range 10000 - 19999
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Switch Fees.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid credit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.
The default category code to be used for Discount Amount.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
A local routine could be attached to this field to perform the NAV calculation to meet local requirements.
This routine should be called with the following seven arguments in the same order as given below :
1) The investment portfolio id - SEC.ACC.MASTER ID ( Incoming argument to the routine )
2) Fund id - MF.FUND.MASTER ID ( Incoming argument )
3) NAV per unit ( Outgoing argument )
4) Offer Price ( Outgoing argument )
5) Bid Price ( Outgoing argument )
6) Total Asset Value ( Outgoing argument )
7) Total no of units ( Incoming argument )
Alternatively, NAV calculation could be performed outside the system and fed manually in the SECURITY.MASTER.The system would use this NAV for all subsequent subscriptions and redemptions.
The default category code to be used if any other fee ( defined in MF.FUND.MASTER ) is not setup and entered manually in the transaction.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Exit Load.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid credit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.

No-input field, which contains the Last Archived Date.This field will be used for validation purposes in the application level in MF.ORDER.BY.CUST, MF.ORDER and MF.TRADE .i.e. Transactions cannot have a trade date / order date prior to this date.
Standard T24 Date format.
The default category code to be used for Miscellaneous Fees.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
The settlement account in switch transactions would be an internal account. This field represents the internal account category to be used for the same.
Mandatory Input. Must exist as a valid CATEGORY code in the range 10000 - 19999
Specifies the default currency market that will be used to calculate all foreign exchange values in the Mutual Funds Module.

The user may choose to define different exchange rates for different currency markets. (e.g. 1 is the T.T. rate, 2 might be the rate for notes and coins etc). This field defines the currency market to be used in all foreign exchange transactions within the Mutual Funds module.
The default value for this field is 1.
Input of 1 Numeric character. (Optional Input)
Must exist on the CURRENCY.MARKET table.
The default accounting transaction code to be used for Entry Load.
Mandatory field for all business models other than 'RETAIL'
Must be a valid credit transaction code defined in the accounting TRANSACTION file.
The default category code to be used if Agent fees is not setup and entered manually in the transaction.
Mandatory Input.Must exist as a valid PL CATEGORY code in the range 50000 - 59999.
This field is to determine whether the company is a Fund management company, retail company or both. The accounting entries would vary depending on the value in this field.
Mandatory Input. Allowed values are FMC, RETAIL or BOTH
Field is removed(Field does not exist)
Field is removed(Field does not exist)
